column2: IDAHO DMV TEST
column4: Idaho

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. When driving in travel lanes on the roadway:
column4: you may make back up quickly if there are no vehicles behind.
column6: do not stop for any reason, keep moving until you can safely pull off the road.
column8: you may make a U-turn if you get on the wrong entrance ramp of the freeway.
column10: you may stop to let out passengers.

column2: 2. Railroad crossings should always be considered:
column4: safe when railroad crossing lights are active.
column6: a place where stopping is required.

column2: 3. This sign means:
column4: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.
column6: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.
column8: The recommended speed limit is 45 MPH.
column10: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column4: 4-way stop

column2: 5. Drivers should always look carefully for motorcycles before changing lanes because:
column4: motorcycles always have the right-of-way at intersections.
column6: motorcycles are not permitted to share traffic lanes.
column8: motorcycles are smaller and harder to see.

column2: 6. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.
column8: Rub your tires on the curb to slow your car.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column4: No left turn

column2: 8. If one of your tires blows out, you should:
column4: pump your brakes and steer where you want to go.
column6: hold the steering wheel tightly, slowly take your foot off the gas pedal and steer smoothly where you want to go.
column10: apply your brakes gently and steer smoothly where you want to go.

column2: 9. What is the slow moving vehicle symbol?
column4: A reflective orange triangle

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column4: Flagger ahead

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column4: No right turn

column2: 12. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column4: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.
column6: It is  hard to judge how far away a motorcycle is.

column2: 13. A 4-way stop sign means:
column4: There are four stop signs at the intersection.
column6: Traffic from all four directions must stop.
column8: The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first.

column2: 14. Aggressive driving includes:
column4: yelling, honking, gesturing at other drivers.
column10: quick lane changes without a signal.

column2: 15. This road sign means:
column4: Winding road ahead

column2: 16. This road sign means:
column4: No right turn
column10: You may turn right after yielding the right-of-way to oncoming traffic

column2: 17. The sign in the picture:
column4: means that you need to stop.
column6: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.
column8: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.
column10: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.

column2: 18. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
column6: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.
column8: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.
column10: On the left side of the road, behind slower vehicles.

column2: 19. At a light rail intersection, you should always:
column4: look both ways before crossing the tracks.
column6: share the road with pedestrians and bicyclists.
column8: be alert and obey all traffic signals.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column4: No left turn

column2: 21. When driving in bad weather, drivers should:
column4: decrease the following distance.
column8: increase their speed to get to their destination more quickly.

column2: 22. If you are pulled over by law enforcement, you should:
column4: stay in the driver’s seat with both hands clearly in sight on the steering wheel.
column6: unbuckle your seat belt and lower your window.
column8: turn off on your interior light if stopped at night.
column10: get out of your vehicle and walk toward the patrol car.

column2: 23. From top to bottom, traffic lights are:
column4: green, yellow and red.

column2: 24. When getting ready to change lanes, you should:
column4: quickly turn your head to check for other vehicles.

column2: 25. Blind spots are:
column4: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.
column6: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.
column8: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.

column2: 26. When driving behind a motorcycle:
column4: allow a following distance of at least 2 car lengths.
column6: allow at least 2 seconds of following distance.
column8: allow a following distance of at least 4 motorcycle lengths.
column10: allow at least 4 seconds of following distance.

column2: 27. What is the most important rule to remember in any emergency?
column4: Do not move.

column2: 28. This traffic sign warns you about:
column4: merging traffic.
column10: a hill or a downgrade up ahead on the road.

column2: 29. What does the pictured signal indicate?
column4: Pedestrians may turn right.
column6: Drivers should walk more and drive less.
column8: A pedestrian may begin crossing the street.
column10: A pedestrian may not not begin crossing the street.

column2: 30. On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
column4: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.
column6: How fit you are. How much alcohol you drink. Your height.
column8: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.
column10: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.

column2: 31. This warning sign means:
column4: Watch out for children crossing the street
column6: Slow down, drive with caution and watch for children

column2: 32. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.
column6: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.
column8: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.

column2: 33. If you are continually being passed on the right, you should:
column4: move into the right lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the left.
column8: pull over to the right and stop until the road is clear.
column10: move into the left lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the right.

column2: 34. This road sign means:
column4: Low clearance

column2: 35. When driving on slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: avoid crossing bridges or intersections.

column2: 36. Double solid yellow lines mean:
column4: passing is not permitted in either direction.
column6: passing is permitted in either direction.
column8: the lane to the left may pass.
column10: the lane to the right may pass.

column2: 37. This sign means:
column4: You may make a U-turn.

column2: 38. Before entering a traffic circle, drivers must slow down and yield to ___________ in the traffic circle.
column4: pedestrians

column2: 39. A steady yellow light means:
column4: Be prepared to stop for the red light.
column6: Be prepared to go. The light will soon be green.
column10: Stop, yield the right-of-way, and go.

column2: 40. The minimum drinking age in this State is ____ years.
